column2: the Prince in coming to the chapel had met with an accident. A young lady of rank
column3: whose duty it was to carry him to and from the chapel
column4: had been so busy arranging her train with one hand
column5: that she stumbled and let him fall. She picked him up—the accident was so slight it seemed hardly worth speaking of. The baby had turned pale
column6: but did not cry. No one knew that anything was wrong. Even if he had moaned
column7: the silver trumpets were loud enough to drown his voice. It would have been a pity to let anything trouble such a day.Such a procession! Heralds in blue and silver; pages in crimson and gold; and a troop of little girls in dazzling white
column9: which they strewed all the way before the child and the nurse
column10: —finally the four and twenty godfathers and godmothers
